title: Contextual Islamic Prayer Learning: Integrating Theory and Practice

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational understanding of Islamic doctrines and basic prayer terminology
context.additional_context: A practice-centered environment emphasizing real-life application, with supplementary learning materials accessible via smartphones

learning_goals: Learners can correctly reproduce the accurate sequence and physical movements of the five obligatory prayers (Wajib Salat) with over 80% accuracy
Learners can explain theological meanings of each prayer unit (Raka'at) - such as Takbir and Quranic verses - by connecting them to moral values in daily life (humility, gratitude)
Learners can apply learned prayer procedures in actual prayer situations with over 90% accuracy within 24 hours after instruction

resources: Audio recording equipment (for repetitive Quranic verse learning)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
